lines.text: He. Could. Go. All. The. Way.
He's listed as day to day, but then again, aren't we all?
(when someone hits a home run) And even with derogatory credit, you can own a brand new car.

[describing a highlight involving football player Keyshawn Johnson]
Just throw me the damn ball.

[describing a win by then-New England Patriots coach Pete Carroll]
And Pete Carroll, raise your hands if you're sure.
Dan Marino - wait, I can see his pores. Pull back.

[describing varied reactions after the New England Patriots defeated the Pittsburg Steelers in the 1996 AFC playoffs]
The Superbowl team of Bill Cowher eliminated, Rod Woodson back and bummed, while Bill Parcells and Curtis Martin are extremely happy, and in the stands I liked the team so much I kissed the owner (Robert Kraft) and the security guard goes, "Hey hey hey, they'll be plenty of time for that later on."
[repeated phrase]
You can't stop him, you can only hope to contain him.
[repeated phrase]
Dare I say, en fuego.

[describing mid-season 1996 NFL standings]
Breathalyzers would have been administered or urine samples collected if you thought it was possible that the Panthers and Cowboys would have identical records after ten games. Dallas improved to 6-4 with Sunday's win in San Francisco; the Panthers could do likewise with a home win over the Giants.
[Fans hold up Chris Berman masks]
AHHHHHHHHHHHHH!
AAAAAAAAAAAA!
Oh, it's just a mask.
Rumblin' bumblin' stumblin'
Say hello to my lil friend
The New York, football, Giants
From the frozen tundra of Lambeau Field
I'm Nick Bakay.
And I'm Robin Bakay.
And we're just livin' the dream.
Boo-yah!

[describing an amazing catch by Derek Jeter]
The guy can go 0 for 50, *never* boo the guy again!

[as a runningback hurries toward the endzone]
He's running like people are chasing him!
Hi, this is Stuart Sco...
Scott Van Pelt, and this is Sportscenter.
He's as cool as the other side of the pillow...
From way downtown, Bang!
Alongside my tag team partner Keith Olbermann... I am merely Dan Patrick.
Hello, greetings, and welcome from world headquarters it's the big show, and alongside my tag-team partner Dan Patrick, I'm *still* Keith Olbermann.
